str2: Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
One. (including the neuter Hen); a primary numeral; one.
So great, so large, so long, so many. From tosos and houtos; so vast as this, i.e. Such.
From the base of pletho; wealth, i.e. money, possessions, or abundance, richness, valuable bestowment.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I make desolate, bring to desolation, destroy, waste, (b) of a person: I strip, rob. From eremos; to lay waste.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
A steersman, pilot; met: a guide, governor. From the same as kubernesis; helmsman, i.e. captain.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A sailor, seaman. From naus; a boatman, i.e. Seaman.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: How much, how great, how many, as great as, as much. By reduplication from hos; as As.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To work, trade, perform, do, practice, commit, acquire by labor.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Probably prolonged from hals; the sea.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: A prolonged form of a primary stao stah'-o; to stand, used in various applications.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
From a (long) distance, afar. Adverb from makros; from a distance or afar.
